data.title: Expose the rest of the SupportPowers to lua
data.body:
Exposes the `NukePower` and the `IonCannonPower`.

`Iron Curtain` (`GrantUpgradePower`), `GpsPower`,  `ProduceActorPower` and `SpawnActorPower` can already be done by manually granting upgrades etc., while `AirstrikePower`, `ParatroopersPower` and `ChronoshiftPower` already are exposed.

Fixes #11011.

data.title: Fix Turreted units not dropping cancelled targets.
data.body:
Fixes #11027.

I don't see a cleaner way to work around this without doing a major rewrite.
The attack code is so horrible :disappointed:

data.title: Fix parachutes in non-heightmapped mods.
data.body: #11015 put the actors at the wrong height, which stops them from being crushable.  This broke crates in RA.

data.title: "Stop" is invalid for defensive structures
data.body: Cannot stop any defensive structure from force attacking. I tried pressing "S", but it didn't work. It only works for infantries and vehicles.

data.title: Getting a System Overflow exception
data.body:
Since updateing my OpenRA I get those system overflow exceptions.

https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/a29b9ff7bede856b975ef69600c445513327736a/OpenRA.Game/WPos.cs#L68 

http://pastebin.com/zpnvNMRY

data.title: Improve log output on dedicated servers.
Fix nod infantry death palette in campaigns.
Respect map creeps configuration.
data.body: Fixes #11022.

data.body:

Might it have something to do with the disabled visceroid spawns? It seems to work fine in skirmish matches.

data.title: Added more support for multiple Mobile
data.body: Actor upgrades are in theory a good idea, but they completely fail with simple things like replacing mobile properties. The engine doesn't like multiple `Mobile` on one actor. Fixed it as far as I could. It will now crash later with "Actor has multiple traits of type `OpenRA.Traits.IOccupySpace`", but I am not able to resolve that.

data.title: There's no way to run ORA on Windows 10
data.body:
I can't run it on my Windows 10 PC. My log files below:
(exception)
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: No suitable renderers were found. Check graphics.log for details.
   於 OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   於 OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   於 OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

data.title: Added lint testing to SpawnActorPower effect sprite and palette
data.body: The property namings were also exactly swapped violating our current standards.

data.title: Fixed GPS power not taking tech center disablement into account
data.body: and as a bonus make it depend on an active radar to punish power down there as well, see also https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7605. Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9962.

data.title: Grouped the radar traits together
data.body: Just moving code that belongs together.

data.title: Don't render WithSpriteBody if it is disabled
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/pull/167#issuecomment-199066996

data.title: Fix paratroopers on heightmapped terrain
data.body:
You can't see the effect in the default mods though (only ra2 will show one).
Anyway, all things that use `Mobile.SetPosition`\* seem to still work fine.

\* e.g. DeliverUnit, SwallowActor, Teleport and Cargo (EjectOnDeath there).

data.title: Added CanUndeploy property
Restore two-button prompt for two-button dialogs.
data.body: Closes #10665.

data.title: Add missing music tracks to global mix database.
data.body: Fixes #10983, which only happens for people who have installed the content from CD.

data.title: .lua support powers doesnt include nuke power
data.body: I was looking through https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Lua-API and it doesn't seem to show support powers such as nukepower or iron curtain.powers to use. It would be nice to have them as a reference instead of me manually finding out how to use these options.

data.title: Randomly at some games, cannot attack other units or attack-move
data.body:
I've been playing with a friend like 6 games.. game 5 something strange happened, I wasn't able to "attack", let me explain:
- When I pressed "A" to attack move the cursor and line didnt' changed to red.. It was like just moving.
- When an enemy unit appeared I wasnt able to press right mouse to attack directly.. I was like I was selecting the other players unit.
- No, we werent on a team. It was a 1on1 game.

Ok.. strange, we played game 6 and every back to normal. Then I try to play an online game with some dudes I don't know and the same thing happened, the strange thing that ther others didn't have the same problem.

Running version 24/12/2015 on Ubuntu Linux.

data.title: Fix northern boundary on new maps.
data.body: Fixes #10944, which is on the release milestone.

data.title: Fix order generator vs unit targeting under left click orders.
data.body: Fixes #10321.

data.title: Unable to define unit groups on OS X
data.body:
OS X El Capitan 10.11.2 (15C50)
Late-2012 MBP
release-20151224

I'm unable to define unit groups using the **Ctrl+0-9** hot keys.

data.title: Tweak the multiplayer server listing.
data.body:
- Filter options are now persisted.
- Started games are now listed by default, and are listed before empty servers.

Closes #10276 and makes our community look a little less dead for new players who haven't yet discovered the filter options.

data.title: Extract dedicated server interface to OpenRA.Server.exe
data.body:
The dedicated server mode has always been bolted on to the side of the game – this extracts it into its own executable where it belongs.  This and #10992 take us a big step towards our long-planned dedicated server overhaul.

Fixes #7252.
Fixes #9065.
Closes #10690.

Partially reverts b2df8d3, c419127.

Ping @baxxxster: this will probably break your bleed server auto-updating script.

data.title: Paradrop Production
data.body:
This is a cleaned-up version of #10266, which I promised @bynnar18 I'd submit on his behalf.

The original PR already had two +1s.

I added a test case, as well as a commit that moves `ProductionFromMapEdge` from d2k to common, because I think it's now more generally useful, for minigames and whatnot.

data.title: Tiberian Sun tunnel passing concept
data.body:
Hi there.

I have some conceptual thoughts about Tiberian Sun and its tunnel passing issue.
Maybe it will bring some new light on a problem, or maybe ideas described here has been already on the table.

I will divide the whole tunnel passing into events. So here we go.

Event one: Unit is approaching the tunnel and when it does, there is a graphical effect on its passing. The shadow casts on that unit.

Event two: The unit is under tunnel and it obviously dissapears. There should be a graphical effect for that event. 

Event three: The map should have some maybe scripted spots that the units visualy turn from normal  look to dots. The dots should be green for friendly and red for enemy. And in that case when friendly units will approach enemy units in the tunnel, the effects of gunfire or explosions are not visible too. How do we do that? By scripts? How we can change the behaviour of certain spots on the maps? Is it like collectable crates? It's definetly not an easy part for a programmer.

Event four: Units are emerging from tunnel, so the dots dissapears and the unit is visible with shadow casting on it. So we have two events. The dot dissapears, the unit pops in it's place. Maybe there is a way of fluent passing from dot to normal look like warping or something like that?

Event five: The unit exits tunnel and the shadow on the unit is no more.

I know it's complicated to implement, maybe i even missed something. I don't know that, i'm not the programmer. It is simply a concept that i have in my mind. I hope this will help in any way to improve TS mod.

data.title: Pillbox/CamPillbox blind spot fix
data.body: Fixes #9529. It is just lame hack, but it works. If you feel like this could break something then tell me and I'll throw it away/change values. Increasing by 1 was not enough so I arbitrarily chose 100.

data.title: Added Dock Uncloak type.
data.body: Closes #10991.
